intro: Flaveria contrayerba, commonly known as the yellow ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in dense, terminal clusters, which bloom in the summer months. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, also known as the sunflower family, and is known for its adaptability to various soil types. Flaveria contrayerba is often found in open habitats such as fields, roadsides, and disturbed areas.
